es.upm.gib.eutilsrdfwrapper
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  es.upm.gib.eutilsrdfwrapper.Controller

public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

This class offers the public programmatic interface for launching queries to NCBI2RDF

Queries can be of two types: - SPARQL: in the form of a String - ConceptsQuery: a self-defined non-standard object that represents a query to this software. It allows defining a primary database and (optionally) secondary databases. For each database, we can define elements to be retrieved and filters to be applied. Each database can be linked to another database through a relation

Results can be returned in two forms: - A results object: a self-defined non-standard object that allows dynamically retrieving results from a performed query - A SPARQL results file: an XML file containing the results in SPARQL Results format

Performs a query and retrieves the results as a Results object which allows retrieving the results as an iterator

Returns:
a Results object for reading the query results

launchQueryGetPath

public static java.lang.String launchQueryGetPath(ConceptsQuery query)
Performs a query and retrieves the results as a SPARQL Results file

Parameters:
query - a ConceptsQuery object containing the query to perform
Returns:
the path to the generated SPARQL Results file. This file will contain 100 results

launchQueryGetPath

public static java.lang.String launchQueryGetPath(java.lang.String query)
Performs a query and retrieves the results as a SPARQL Results file

Parameters:
query - a SPARQL query
Returns:
the path to the generated SPARQL Results file. This file will contain as many results as indicated in the LIMIT element of the SPARQL query, or 100 if no limit was indicated in the query
